# readtext { #pybiber.parse_utils.readtext }

```python
parse_utils.readtext(paths)
```

Import all text files from a list of paths.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                               | Default    |
|--------|--------|-----------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| paths  | List   | A list of paths of text files returned by get_text_paths. | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description           |
|--------|--------|-----------------------|
|        | List   | A list of full paths. |

## Notes {.doc-section .doc-section-notes}

Modeled on the R function
[readtext](https://readtext.quanteda.io/articles/readtext_vignette.html).
